sentence.text: TCIRG1 knockdown suppressed tumor cell growth and proliferation in phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation cell lines; caused a significant increase in the proportion of cells in the G1/S phase of cell cycle; induced cell death; suppressed the metastatic potential of HCC cells by selectively regulating the epithelial-mesenchymal transition (cytokine production) regulatory proteins E-integrin-mediated signaling pathway, N-cadherin, Fibronectin, Snail and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; and significantly attenuated the metastatic potential of ras-transformed NIH-3T3 cells in vitro and in vivo.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
